definition: Many little things add up to sth great./Many little drops make an ocean. (idiom)

to amass/to accumulate/to store/measured quantity (such as area of volume)/product (the result of multiplication)/to integrate (math.)/to solve (or integrate) an ordinary differential equation (math.)/old/long-standing
few/less/to lack/to be missing/to stop (doing sth)/seldom
to succeed/to finish/to complete/to accomplish/to become/to turn into/to be all right/OK!/one tenth
many/much/often/a lot of/numerous/more/in excess/how (to what extent)/multi-/Taiwan pr. [duo2] when it means "how"

sentences.english: Every a little makes a mickle.
To paraphrase Tesco's slogan, it seems that every little scrap of information helps.
sentences.chinese: 借用樂購的標語，似乎正是涓流成河，積少成多。

sentences.english: Many a little makes a mickle. Over time, a long levee of logs was thus formed.
sentences.chinese: 日積月累，積少成多，就形成了現在的這條枯木長堤。

sentences.english: Although such likelihoods effect is very little, but many a little makes a mickle .
sentences.chinese: 雖然這樣可能作用非常小，但是積少成多。

sentences.english: A drop of water is very infinitesimal, but do you know many a pickle makes a muckle 's truth?
sentences.chinese: 一滴水是十分微小的，但是你知道積少成多的道理嗎？

definition: to assess one's income and spend accordingly (idiom); to live within one's means/You can only spend what you earn.
to help the poor/almsgiving for the needy/to assist poor households or poor regions
lit. a horse that brings trouble to its herd (idiom)/fig. troublemaker/black sheep/rotten apple
to extort under false pretenses/to blackmail/to bluff/to defraud
(of a student) to work part-time (while continuing one's studies)/(of a delinquent) to be reformed through work and study
